answers.author: Eric Eddy
answers.text:
A couple of examples from Colorado and one from Florida:
City of Centennial provides Public Works, Park Maintenance, Facility Maintenance, Engineering Services, and Code Compliance through several contracts with CH2MHill (http://www.omi.ch2mhill.com/news/releases/2008/07-01-08_Centennial.html)
The city of Lone Tree also contracts out their Public Works, although I don't have a simple summary of their operations. 
Arapahoe County Sheriff's Office is contracted to provide law enforcement to several municipalities within the County (no link for this, but it includes Centennial, Foxfield, Deer Trail, among others. ACSO operates a seperate unit within the department for the city of Centennial.)
Jefferson County and municipalities are working together for animal shelter provision. The new IGA on this is actually a fairly interesting read, and can be found on JeffCo's website.  (http://www.foothillsanimalshelter.org/about/historymission/)
Several cities/utilities in northwest Florida have formed the Fairport Regional Utility System in order to provide wholesale water for their utility systems. 
Hopefully these at least give you a jumping off point, but please send me an email if you have any questions or want any additional information.

answers.author: Jonathan Walker
answers.text:
Centennial, Colorado also outsources building department services to SAFEbuilt.  
SAFEbuilt also has a shared services model where several communities utilize one building department staff.  We have several examples of this in Colorado as well as Atlanta.   I would be happy to talk with you about those.

author: Reid Wodicka
text:
Hello,
I'm a PhD student working on a book chapter on innovative methods of service delivery in local governments, particularly relating to consolidated or shared services between governing units (city and city, county and city, etc.). Could anyone point me to some examples that could be used as case studies?
Thanks,
Reid Wodicka
title: Innovation in municipal shared services
